## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I have a couple of questions. What are some limitations to be aware of when working with multi-currency in Verus, and how do I properly reset my testnet environment after an update?

**AI Assistant:**
When using Verus, there are a few limitations to be aware of when working with multi-currency:

**Limitation 1:**
In both the Graphical User Interface (GUI) and Command Line Interface (CLI), you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. This is because using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but it will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies.

**Limitation 2:**
In the GUI, if a currency is already supported in the Verus Desktop, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is currently a known issue, but it will be resolved in future releases.

Now, regarding resetting your testnet environment after an update:

If you have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to the current update, you need to delete the following directories before running the new update:
* On Linux: `~/.komodo/vrsctest`
* On MacOS: `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest`
* On Windows: `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST`

By deleting these directories, you will ensure a clean start with the new update and avoid any potential issues with your testnet environment.

Do you have any further questions about these limitations or resetting your testnet environment?

When using Verus, there are a few limitations to be aware of when working with multi-currency:

**Limitation 1:**
In both the Graphical User Interface (GUI) and Command Line Interface (CLI), you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. ## Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/vrsctest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
```# Disclaimer
